Subtitles.Static: The savior of souls!
Welcome back, Trent. The usual?
Sure, I'll have two!
Any reason for this celebration?
Absolutely. Two reasons actually! First of all, I have finally managed to pay off all my debts!
For the beginning of a new life! This one's on me!
Thanks, friend! You are definitely the best person in this godforsaken place!
But if there's a "first of all", there should be "second of all". Go on and tell me, or else I'll die of curiousity.
Don't you dare die on me! I'd never get over the loss.
An old friend sent me a message.
Look.
Greetings, Trent! This is Alaric! Good news. I think we can fix the hole in your finnances. Meet me at Magdeburg, Sigma-13 System. See you soon!
What do you think?
I think you're the luckiest son of a bitch on this junkpile of a planet.
No, I mean... Should I agree and go there?

You could, of course, let things be as they are and do nothing. Got enough money to sustain yourself; a risk-free life, other than dying in your 40s working in the mine. But, I think, if life gives you a chance to get out of this mud-hole - it's a sin not to take that chance. But, it's your call.
So why aren't you flying away from this "mud-hole" yourself?

This, friend, is my mud-hole. I've grown into it and I love it. And I don't have friends like yours, asking me to drop everything I'm doing and come over to Magdeburg. And if I would leave, who's going to be the savior of strangers' souls?
You're right, without you this place would've been gloomy. I guess I'll head to the spaceport, then.
Good luck, Trent! Hopefully, we'll never meet here again.
Hi Trent, glad to see you!
You too, Alaric.
I heard that you've finally dealt with that problem. No more debts, no more duties, right?
Mhm, no ship and no money either. But it has its benefits - no problems with cargo holds. What's mine is mine.
A great time to start a new page in your life, isn't it?
I could use a partner for a well-paid job.
I'll give you a ship. An old one, of course, but it will definitely survive a few flights till decommission.
Gotta escort a few Rheinlanders from New Berlin to Bismark. They pay good, real good.
Interesting, why would Rheinlanders hire escorts to fly from one system to another, inside their own territory?
And a spaceship, you say? You're leaving me no choice, Al!
Excellent! The ship's waiting for you in the hangar. Check everything over, and I'll meet you outside when you're ready.
Your ticket and documents, sir.
Trent?.. Are you...
No, just a coincidence.
I'm so sick of it. While my namesake was saving the universe, I was working my ass off to pay off those stupid debts...
Guten tag, gentlemen. This is Trent, my friend I was telling you about.
Excellent. We're glad to see you. We have a few problems in our system. Hopefully, they didn't bother you too much.
A little bit. I'm just glad we made it here.
Great. If you're doing fine, then let's begin.
Thank you for the escort! The money's already being transferred to your accounts!
You're welcome.
Additionally, we, as members of the Hanseatic trading community, have added you to our freelancers' whitelist.
From now on, you can take any missions offered by the Hanseatic merchants.

And here's for a special thanks to you, gentlemen! Trent, have you heard? We are no longer some kind of beggers in Rheinland territory, but official freelancers accredited by the Hanseatic trading community!
Will I live...
And... Trent, a quick word of advice: As soon as you can, get yourself a newer ship to fly around in. No offense, but such antiquities are bought for novelty reasons. Not to actually fly in space.
I'll think about it.
So, how's your new life going, Trent?
Exciting. But... Now that I have my own ship, I'm ready to go down the devil's throat.
Now that you have the money to maintain and refurbish it. And to think it through - you should buy a new one. As painful as it may sound, Luts made a great point.
He can suck it. Maybe he has enough money to change ships every goddamn year, but I'm not a millionaire yet.
Then just think about upgrading what you already have.

On that battle, in the asteroid field, you most certainly didn't have enough energy. It certainly won't hurt you to get a better power generator. And take a look at the rest of the package. This chassis is very flexible in terms of upgrades. Most of its modules can be replaced with better ones...
OK Trent, I got some business to take care of. It requires my immediate attention so I better get going. Will you manage here without me?
I'll try... Good luck, Alaric!!!
Bye-bye!
Wilhelm, I assume?
Indeed, Herr Trent. I'm glad that you've chosen to work with us.

I haven't agreed yet, but I'm definitely interested. It's not every day that a representative of the Rheinland military messages my PDA, with a proposal to meet in person, on board a Rheinland military battleship.
Which messages are you referring to?
These ones... Shit. What's going on? They were right there...
To hell with those messages, Herr Trent, let's get to the point. And so, I hope you understand, that regardless of how our conversation ends, all its details should remain between us?
Should - means they would. You military guys don't like messing around... By the way, why me?
Why not? You proved yourself well in the Brandenburg Outpost incident.
Gotcha. Let's get to the mission, shall we?
Alright. Like any other government, we have some informants in territories of our, let's say, geopolitical rivals. You understand?
Sure.

Very well. Not so long ago, one of our informants contacted us via secure channel, reporting that he had extremely critical information and headed to our dedicated data transmission point. And, as traditional detective stories go, he never arrived there. No sign received from him during the last week, neither in the transmission point, nor through emergency channels. It can only mean one thing - he is dead.

Based on the analysis of chatter between station dispatchers and operators of emergency services in the area of our interest, with a probability of over ninety-nine percent, we've established that the ship of our informant was attacked, and he was killed.
My condolences. But what do I have to do with it?

Your mission is to find that ship and remove the data of interest from it. It has to be done as soon as possible, since the activity of so-called â€œJunkersâ€ in the area is extremely high. You have to get ahead of them.
I doubt that I can get ahead of them. First of all, I don't know the area as well as they do. Secondly, unlike them, I'll be there on my own.

You can. The thing is, there's a tech enthusiast who's developing devices that can track them and listen to their radio comms. We've been interested in luring him into our department for a while now, so we're closely watching him.
Like you're watching me?

Even closer. He's been testing his devices in our area of interest. Therefore, he has the best intel regarding every event that recently occurred in that area of space. You'll have to get in touch with him, make an arrangement to get the informant's ship's wreckage coordinates, remove the data from it, and transfer it to us... Without letting any scavenger get to it before you do, naturally.
And that's it? Can I start now?
If you agree, there's no "I", but a "We". I'll be assigned as your partner for the duration of this mission.
Will you be in control of my actions?

No. I'll be your wingman and help you interact with the authorities - I have a fairly high level of clearance in Rheinland systems. The strategical and tactical sides of this operation are entirely on you, Herr Trent.
Thanks for trusting me... Where do I sign?
Ha-ha-ha. Why would we require such formalities? I'll meet you in space, Herr Trent!
Greetings!
Likewise. What'cha need?
Wilhelm sent me.
Very well.
And what does Herr Wilhelm need this time?
Coordinates of some wrecked ship.

Ah! Piece of cake. I'll throw in all the points of accidents involving damage to ships over the past month. Accuracy of twenty millimeters, give or take a few. Choose the one you need, filtered by criteria. No need to thank me.
We'll fly there together.
And why's that?

Wilhelm said that you'll point me to the place of our interest, and I'll have to find it. And how can I possibly know that you're not bullshitting me, to make a half-an-hour trip last till dawn? The military has their own quirks, and so does the freelancer.
A hundred times I curse the day I agreed to help Wilhelm.
And where's he now? Chilling in a bar on a nearby trading outpost?
Whatever happens out there, he has nothing to do with it, while you and I are the main characters.
So here's the famous Trent.
And what am I so famous for, Mr... Umm...
Reichmann. Admiral Reichmann, if you may.
It's my honor, Admiral Reichmann! So, what am I so famous for?
Oh, Herr Trent, lately some of the higher circles have all been talking about you! I hope Herr Wilhelm adequately pays for your work.
I'm not complaining.
Modesty - a commendable virtue, Herr Trent, I see virtue often taken for granted. I'll make sure the payment for your last mission will be doubled. All the best to you, Herr Trent!
So you think that he's the one we need?
Undoubtedly, Herr Admiral. He's the one who can help us accomplish all our tasks at hand.
Can you guarantee that?
Absolutely!
Very well, We implement your plan.
Thank you for your trust.
We will see what comes out of that. You're dismissed, Herr Wilhelm.
Greetings, gentlemen.
There you are, Herr Trent. Meet Herr Hassler. This mission will require both of you to tightly work together.
An honor to meet you, Herr Hassler.
And what will we do on this mission?
The usual thing. Fly, shoot, nothing new.
And someone is watching from a safe distance. Definitely nothing new. Can you be more specific?
Of course. Our intelligence managed to track down Dietrich's position. He's on an ex-military base in Konigsberg.
A strike fleet is preparing to attack that base as we speak. However, our analytics predict that a direct attack on Konigsberg would cause severe losses on our side.
That's why we're forming a mobile strike team, whose task will be to neutralize the base's defense systems by the time our main strike fleet approaches it.
You mean, those will be the guys who drag fire away from your asses.
Correct, Herr Trent. By the way, Admiral Reichmann personally insisted on your participation in this mission.

I'm flattered. Could you tell me how an elite military base, with top class defense systems, practically in the very center of Rheinland's territory, got abandoned and fell into the hands of rebels and Corsairs?

Herr Trent, at that time there were two such bases in Rheinland territory - Konigsberg and Regensburg, both in the Munich system, on the border with Kusari. The Kusari military saw Regensburg as nothing more than a pain in their ass.

During our last conflict with Kusari, we suffered a crushing defeat, and under the terms of a peace treaty we were forced to demilitarize Munich. The construction of Konigsberg was halted just before it was finished...

Our government couldn't bother destroying Konigsberg, or disassembling it. Maybe they hoped for the peace treaty to be re-negotiated so they can put the base into use, I don't know. Eventually, it appeared that Dietrich, one of the highest-ranking military personnel, having all the access keys, simply occupied it...
It seems that asking all sorts of stupid questions, like whether I have a choice, is inappropriate in this situation.
You're a wise man, Herr Trent.
Herr Trent, ninety percent of the local freelancers can only dream of being in your shoes. You're being paid generously, and reporting directly to Admiral Reichmann.
Why are you as nervous as a high-school student before graduation? Let's fly. I'll see you in space.

I asked the locals, they don't know shit. Anyways, thank you, Trent. Your work here is done, we'll be looking for the transport on our channels. Unfortunately, since we screwed up, Reichmann significantly cut the payment.
Strange. The base was destroyed, Dietrich's dead, and Reichmann freaks out because of some transport. I don't like this.
Me neither... The money's been transferred to your account. See you later.
Herr Trent, is that you?
Herr Trent, thank you so much for coming. I'm in trouble. The Rheinland authorities are looking for me.
I already guessed that. And I'm getting that familiar sense of someone trying to get me into trouble.
Herr Trent, you do not understand. A matter of utmost importance. I need to deliver important documents to Liberty.
And yet again I'm being dragged into a game of espionage... Jacobo, are you aware that I'm currently working for the very same Rheinland authorities you're trying to avoid?
Herr Trent, you're a freelancer. You did not take an oath. After the job is done, nothing connects you to your client.
Herr Trent, if we can deliver these VERY important documents to Liberty, to the Forbes system, they'll pay us a lot of money, and I mean a LOT, you see?
I probably won't make it alone, but with you on my side...
And if you don't help me, they'll probably just kill me...
I'm gonna regret doing that... So, what's the plan?
Herr Trent, thank you! You won't regret it! Launch into space. My friends will help me get to the landing pad quietly. Meet me in orbit.
See you there.
This is commander Marcus Creitmire of the Hessian Lions special operations unit.
Power down your weapon systems immediately, and follow our lead. If you try to resist, we have the authority to destroy you.
Herr Creitmire, you're being misled! Manipulated! Let go of the escort!
Words - they take too much time. Torpedoes are faster.
Gentlemen.
Miss Hatcher.
Miss Hatcher, you have such lovely, deep eyes.
Cut this nonsense immediately, you don't want to irritate me.
Let's get to our business. You've done a fine job.
I will avoid asking how you managed to escape Rheinland with THIS kind of material.
I'm a delicate lady, I'm afraid I might not be able to handle it.
We did what we had to do.

Heh, seems like you had fun. And by the way, We Are looking for top-notch skilled Freelancers such as yourselves to help us perform, say, some non-standard tasks. Have you got any plans for the near future?
We've always got time for you...
Shut up, Alaric. Since we're now considered enemies of the Rheinland state, I suppose we don't have any plans yet.
So, if we have a couple of well-paid tasks that fit your field of work...
Then we won't hesitate to fulfill them. That is, unless these tasks make us enemies of the Liberty state, too.
Oh dear, no, I don't think it'll ever come to this.
Sure hope so...
Awesome, Trent! Who knew you'd be so good at finding clients and closing deals?
I'm also good at making enemies and getting close to being murdered.
Oh come on... You just started your freelancing career, a complete newbie, and now you're taking jobs for the government with appropriate payments!
Mhm, one of those governments have already put a price on my head. And oh do I hope they forget about me soon with everything that's going on there.
Seriously, the Rheinland military will most likely fall apart soon. They won't bother looking for us.
You seem very confident. Come on, Alaric, what are you hiding from me?
That Miss Hatcher, do you know who she is?
Well, of course I do! I've known her for a whole three hours! Screw you, Alaric.
She's an officer in one of Liberty's secret service agencies.
God dammit! Not again...
"You don't get it. It's such a special and secret service, that not even their own counterparts in their own government know they exist."
Then how do you know that, Alaric?
I can't believe I got into this mess again!
